headline: Deportation Officer at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary: I am a public service professional who has excelled in meeting the high demands of The Department of Homeland Security. I possess solid leadership skills, developed through training and experience. I have a proven work ethic, self-discipline and a demonstrated ability to accomplish assigned tasks. I adapt easily to change and calmly overcome obstacles.

â¢	Apply a comprehensive range of federal laws, rules, and regulations including enforcing Titles 8, 18, 19, 21 and the Immigration and Nationality Act (INA).
â¢	Arrest individuals committing federal crimes including individuals illegally in the United States.
â¢	Investigate the smuggling of aliens and contraband, and apply necessary laws to prosecute smugglers.
positions.title: Border Patrol Agent

positions.description: TDY Operations Officer for the Field Intelligence Division and Strategic Planning and Policy

Alien Smuggler Identification and Deterrence (ASID) unit

â¢	Integrate operations with other Customs and Border Protection (CBP) assets to ensure a unified, integrated, and cohesive approach to border security.
â¢	Enhance layered enforcement activities relative to narcotics and alien smuggling, by identifying Drug Trafficking Organizations, high-risk individuals, and their associates.
positions.title: Border Patrol Agent - Intelligence and Operations

positions.description:
â¢	Responsible for the daily operations of the Tucson Coordination Center (TCC). Supervised 30 agents and 30 support staff in detention, processing, and removal of both criminal and non-criminal aliens.
â¢	Coordinate with 8 Border Patrol stations and private contractors for detention, processing and transportation for up to 400 detainees daily.
â¢	Lead the training of agents detailed to the TCC and assimilated them to the proper standards and protocol.
â¢	Created and implemented the use of the âBox Tops for Educationâ program at the TCC to support local schools.
â¢	Inspired important changes to the E3 processing application that allowed agents to include apprehension statistics for tracking purposes.
positions.title: (A) Supervisory Border Patrol Agent
